background: A food truck owner is in the business of selling mangos and guavas to maximize profit, considering the budget, costs, and sales estimates.
constraints: Number of mangos is an integer
Number of guavas is an integer
Number of mangos is greater than or equal to MinMangos
Number of mangos is less than or equal to MaxMangos
The cost of mangos and guavas cannot exceed MaxBudget
Number of guavas sold is at most RatioGuavas times the number of mangos sold
objective: Maximize the profit from selling mangos and guavas
description: A food truck owner can spend at most \var{MaxBudget} on mangos and guavas. A mango costs the food truck owner \var{CostMango} and a guava costs him \var{CostGuava}. Spices are added and each mango is sold for a profit of \var{ProfitMango} while each guava is sold for a profit of \var{ProfitGuava}. The owner estimates that at least \var{MinMangos} mangos but at the most \var{MaxMangos} are sold each month. He also estimates that the number of guavas sold is at most a third of the mangos sold (expressed as \var{RatioGuavas} times the number of mangos). How many mangos and guavas should be sold in order to maximize the profit?

parameters.definition: Maximum budget for mangos and guavas
Maximum guavas sold per month as a ratio of mangos sold
